case_vignette: A 7-year-old healthy boy is brought to the dermatology clinic by his parents after having had a 3-week history of a rash. The patient’s rash was slightly pruritic, and it involved predominantly the trunk, starting as one larger pink patch with fine scale and subsequently spreading with smaller similar macules and patches. The boy’s palms and soles were spared of the rash.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've had a rash for the past 3 weeks that's a bit itchy, especially on my belly, and it started with a big pink spot that then spread out into smaller ones just like it.
Have you noticed any other symptoms such as fever, joint pain, or fatigue?
No, I haven't had any fever, joint pain, or been feeling really tired or anything, just the rash.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or lifestyle?
No, there haven't been any changes in what I eat or what I do every day.
Have you had any recent travel or exposure to any new environments?
No, I haven't traveled anywhere or been anywhere new recently.
Have you had any recent injuries or cuts on your skin?
No, I haven't had any injuries or cuts on my skin.
Have you had any recent allergies or reactions to any medications or products?
No, I haven't had any allergies or reactions to medications or products.
Have you had any family members with similar symptoms in the past?
No, nobody in my family has had symptoms like this before.
Final Diagnosis: Eczema.
